page.title: 01BARLING MAGNA
page.content: Barling is a very nice village near Southend-on-Sea. When the Saxons came here they anchored in the creek and some people believe that their leader Berela built his house beside the marshes. The settlement was called after him. Later it changed to Barling. Other people say that the name comes from two Saxon words "ban" a boar and "ing" a meadow. The older part is near the church but much of the newer housing stretches along Little Wakering Road.It is a quiet place and all round us is flat farmland.The River Roach is to the North of the village and Barling Creek winds round it. The nearest railway station is in Shoebury and it takes an hour to travel to London. From Southend there are two separate railways to London.
